seo.title: Path of the Gods via Amalfi bus
seo.description: Ride the SITA buses through Amalfi to Bomerano, then hike to Nocelle and return by shuttle with a full-day plan.

linkLabel: Path of the Gods: Budget-Friendly Bus & Hike
intro: Prefer to stay on wheels? This route takes the SITA bus from Positano to Amalfi and onward to Bomerano before hiking the Path of the Gods back toward Nocelle. It is dependable in rough seas and often the quickest way to reach the full trail.
Buses get busy in peak season, so buy tickets the day before if possible and arrive early at each stop.

sections.title: Buy tickets and plan your timing
body: You need three bus tickets per person: Positano → Amalfi, Amalfi → Bomerano, and Nocelle → Positano. Ask the staff at Bar Internazionale for the best combination (single or integrated).
Check the SITA timetable posted inside the bar or via the Unico Campania app. Aim for a morning departure to avoid queues and midday sun on the trail.
Pack water, snacks, and sun protection—there are no services between Bomerano and Nocelle.

images.alt: Bar Internazionale café location in Positano where SITA bus tickets are sold
images.caption: Bar Internazionale — buy your three SITA tickets here before boarding the bus

sections.title: Ride from Bar Internazionale to Amalfi
body: Exit the hostel, turn left, and reach Bar Internazionale in about two minutes. Buy tickets, then wait on the opposite side of the road for the Amalfi-bound bus.
Validate your ticket when boarding. The journey takes 45–60 minutes depending on traffic and includes several switchbacks with sweeping sea views.
When you arrive in Amalfi, stay near the same bus bays—you will connect to the Agerola service from there.

sections.title: Pause in Amalfi (optional)
body: If you have a gap before the next bus, wander a short distance into town for coffee or pastries. Return to the terminal at least 10 minutes before departure.
Queue early during summer as the bus fills quickly. The driver may limit boarding once all seats and safe standing room are taken.

sections.title: Bus uphill to Bomerano
body: Board the bus marked 'Agerola/Bomerano'. Use your second ticket and keep a hand free to steady yourself on tight curves.
Alight at the Bomerano stop opposite Ristorante Jerla. Cross the road, take the side street to the piazza, then follow signs to the Path of the Gods trailhead.

images.alt: Bomerano bus stop with Ristorante Jerla signpost
images.caption: Bomerano stop — look for Jerla restaurant, then cross the road and head to the piazza

sections.title: Hike to Nocelle
body: Follow the Sentiero degli Dei signage across terraces and ridges. Allow 2.5–3 hours for the hike with photo stops.
Carry litter out with you and respect private farmland along the path.

images.alt: Side street with Path of the Gods notice board in Bomerano
images.caption: Path of the Gods notice board — marks the start of the trail after crossing the piazza

images.alt: Piazza in Bomerano showing left-side route through town
images.caption: Navigate left across the town square toward the trailhead

images.alt: Footpath descending with wooden steps section on the trail
images.caption: Trail section — expect descents followed by wooden step climbs along the ridge

images.alt: Concrete walkway marking transition from trail into Nocelle village
images.caption: Concrete walkway signals the end of the trail and the beginning of Nocelle

sections.title: Navigate Nocelle and reach the bus stop
body: When the trail turns to concrete, you have reached Nocelle. Keep right at the first junction to avoid the long staircase down to Positano.
Walk about 175 metres to the small car park and bus shelter. Arrive early; buses occasionally park just before the stop when the lot is full.

images.alt: Nocelle navigation map showing route to bus stop with warning about stairs
images.caption: Nocelle route map — keep right to reach the bus stop and avoid the 1,700-step staircase

images.alt: Directional signpost in Nocelle showing stairs to Positano to avoid
images.caption: Critical junction — do NOT take the stairs to Positano unless you want a grueling descent

images.alt: Final walkway and stairs leading to Nocelle bus stop
images.caption: Final 175 meters to the bus stop — arrive early as buses may park before the shelter

sections.title: Return to Positano
body: Use your final ticket to ride the Nocelle/Montepertuso bus back to Bar Internazionale or Chiesa Nuova.
If you miss the bus, you can walk the road (around 4 km) but be prepared for a sustained downhill with traffic.

sections.title: Sample timetable
body: 07:00 leave hostel → 07:15 bus to Amalfi → 08:10 arrive Amalfi → 08:30 bus to Bomerano → 09:10 start hike → 12:00 arrive Nocelle → 12:30 bus back to Positano.
Later morning option: 08:00 departure still returns mid-afternoon if connections line up.

essentials: Three SITA tickets per person (Positano → Amalfi, Amalfi → Bomerano, Nocelle → Positano) plus a spare.
Water, snacks, sunscreen, and layers for an exposed ridge hike.
Comfortable footwear with grip and a charged phone with offline maps.
typicalCosts: SITA bus tickets: €2–€4 per leg depending on carnet or integrated fares.
Coffee or snacks during the Amalfi connection: €2–€6.
tips: Arrive 10–15 minutes early at every stop—buses can fill before high season departures.
Sit on the right-hand side leaving Positano for sweeping coastal views, and on the left when returning from Amalfi.
Carry small change in case you need to validate an extra ticket on board.
warnings: Do not follow the 1,700-step staircase from Nocelle unless you are prepared for a strenuous, knee-intensive descent.
Weekend services can run late; keep snacks and water handy in case you wait longer than planned.
Peak-hour buses may cap standing passengers—be prepared to let one pass and board the next.

steps.name: Buy SITA tickets
steps.text: Purchase the required bus tickets at Bar Internazionale before departure.

steps.name: Bus to Amalfi
steps.text: Catch the Amalfi-bound bus from Bar Internazionale and stay on through the coastal villages.

steps.name: Transfer to the Agerola bus
steps.text: Wait by the Amalfi terminal and board the service marked Agerola/Bomerano.

steps.name: Reach the trailhead
steps.text: Disembark at Bomerano, follow signs through the piazza, and join the Sentiero degli Dei.

steps.name: Hike to Nocelle
steps.text: Follow CAI waymarks across the ridge until you reach the concrete walkway into town.

steps.name: Return by bus
steps.text: Catch the Nocelle/Montepertuso bus back to Bar Internazionale or Chiesa Nuova.

a: Morning services fill quickly in summer. Arrive early, queue calmly, and be ready to stand. Drivers may refuse boarding once the aisle is full.

faqs.q: Can I stop in Amalfi for sightseeing?
a: Yes—allow at least one full bus interval (30–60 minutes) so you have time to explore and still rejoin the queue before the next Agerola departure.

faqs.q: What if I miss the Nocelle bus back?
a: Check the posted timetable at the stop. If the next bus is over an hour away, you can walk the paved road down to Positano in about 45–60 minutes.

faqs.q: How do I read the SITA bus timetable?
a: **Reading the Rows:** The rows in the first column represent different bus stops along the route.

**Reading the Columns:** The timetable assigns an alphabetical letter to each scheduled journey, which are listed as headers in each column. If you are traveling Monday through Saturday, look for columns 'F' and 'G'. If you are traveling on Sunday or a holiday, look for columns 'G' and 'H'.

**Combining Rows and Columns:** Choose your departure and arrival bus stops, then check the columns to see when buses are available and what time they will arrive at your destination. For example, to see the departure time from Sorrento, look at the Sorrento row. To see the arrival time in Positano (Chiesa Nuova / Bar Internazionale), look at the Positano (Chiesa Nuova) row.
